title: Calories in Curried Chicken
meta_description: Discover calories in curried chicken per serving, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and recipe tweaks for your diet.
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken breast cooked in a tomato-onion curry sauce with garlic, ginger, spices, and 1 tsp oil; moderate seasoning; no dairy or coconut.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, cooking method, and added fats; homemade vs. restaurant versions differ. Check labels or recipes when available.

quick_answer.text: 200 g of curried chicken provides about 300 kcal and 50 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant items.

tweaks.label: Add 50 ml coconut milk per 100 g
Use chicken thighs instead of breast per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 200 g curried chicken?
faqs.a: Approximately 300 kcal for a standard tomato-based recipe.

faqs.q: What's the protein in curried chicken?
faqs.a: About 25 g protein per 100 g, or 50 g per 200 g serving.

faqs.q: Does curried chicken have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 300 mg per 100 g due to spices and salt; adjust seasoning to reduce.

faqs.q: How do carbs in curried chicken compare to plain chicken?
faqs.a: Higher at 4 g per 100 g from sauce veggies and spices, vs. 0 g in plain grilled chicken.

faqs.q: Can I make curried chicken lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, use less oil, more veggies, or yogurt instead of cream to cut fat and calories.
